AddRDS.yml.Username: Specify an alphanumeric string that defines the login ID for the master user. You use the master user login to start defining all users, objects, and permissions in a databases of your DB instance. Master Username must start with a letter.
AddRDS.yml.AutoPause: Specify the amount of time to pass with no database traffic before you scale to zero processing capacity. When database traffic resumes, your Serverless cluster resumes processing capacity and scales to handle the traffic.\
AddRDS.yml.EngineVersion: Select database engine version. If not selected latest version will be used while creating database. Select type as 'Other' if you don't see desired option in dropdown list.
AddRDS.yml.Identifier: Provide unique identifier for the RDS instance across all tenants.  The cluster identifier is used in determining the cluster's endpoint.
AddRDS.yml.EncryptionKey: Choose to encrypt the given instance.
AddRDS.yml.Engine: Select Database engine for creating RDS instance.
AddRDS.yml.MultiAZ: Create database in multiple availability zones for high availability.
AddRDS.yml.EnableLogging: Select this option to enable logging for the RDS instance.
AddRDS.yml.AutoPauseDuration: Amount of time the cluster can be idle before scaling to zero
AddRDS.yml.MinCapacity: Set the minimum capacity unit for the DB cluster. Each capacity unit is equivalent to a specific compute and memory configuration.
AddRDS.yml.AllocatedStorage: Storage allication for RDS instance in GB.
AddRDS.yml.DbSize: Instance size for RDS. Select type as 'Other' if you don't see desired option in dropdown list.
AddRDS.yml.SnapshotId: Select this when you want to create RDS instance from existing Snapshot.
AddRDS.yml.Password: Specify a string that defines the password for the master user. Master Password must be at least eight characters long.
AddRDS.yml.MaxCapacity: Set the maximum capacity unit for the DB cluster. Each capacity unit is equivalent to a specific compute and memory configuration.
